title: full effect to Regulation (EU) 2017/1938 of the European Parliament and of the
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Security of
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Security of 

Natural Gas Supply) Regulations 2020. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (security natural gas supply) regulation 2020 interpretation

title: full effect to Regulation (EU) 2017/1938 of the European Parliament and of the
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations -
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations - 

“Commission” means Commission for Regulation of Utilities; 

“competent authority” means the body designated as the competent authority 
under Regulation 3; 

“customer” means a wholesale or final customer of natural gas or a natural gas 
or electricity undertaking which purchases natural gas; 

“EU Regulation” means Regulation (EU) 2017/1938 of the European Parliament 
and of the Council of 25 October 2017 concerning measures to safeguard the 
security of gas supply and repealing Regulation (EU) No. 994/20101; 

“final customer” means a customer purchasing natural gas for his or her or its 
own use; 

“household customer” means a customer purchasing natural gas for his or her 
own household consumption; 

“Minister” means Minister for the Environment, Climate and Communications; 

“natural gas undertaking” means any natural or legal person engaged in the 
production, transmission, distribution, shipping, supply, purchase or storage of 
natural gas, including Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG), that is responsible for the 
commercial, technical or maintenance tasks related to those functions, but does 
not include final customers; 

“protected customer” means household customers connected to a gas 
distribution network and any other category of customer, or customers, as may 
be designated as protected by the Commission within the meaning of the 
definition of ‘protected customer’ in Article 2(5) of the EU Regulation; 

“security of supply” means security of supply of natural gas, including the 
security of the national electricity supply, and technical safety. 

1 OJ No. L. 280, 28.10.2017, p. 1 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 8th January, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [745] 3 

(2) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and is also used 
in the EU Regulation has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same 
meaning in these Regulations as it has in the EU Regulation. 

Functions of Commission with regard to security of supply

title: full effect to Regulation (EU) 2017/1938 of the European Parliament and of the
heading: 3. (1) The Commission is designated as the competent authority for the
text_raw:
3. (1) The Commission is designated as the competent authority for the 
purposes of the EU Regulation and these Regulations and shall perform the 
functions of competent authority for the purposes of, and as provided for in, the 
EU Regulation. 

(2) The Commission shall have the following functions with regard to 

security of natural gas supply: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

to establish a regulatory framework to ensure adequate levels of 
security of supply; 

to ensure compliance with and, as competent authority, to 
perform such tasks as are necessary for, or are incidental and 
supplementary to, the administration and implementation of, the 
EU Regulation; 

to designate the categories of customers to be defined as protected 
customers; 

to submit an annual report to the Minister, not later than the 31st 
day of October of each year, regarding the measures it has taken 
under the EU Regulation, which shall include such information 
as the Minister may request in relation to the security of supply. 

Offences and penalties

title: full effect to Regulation (EU) 2017/1938 of the European Parliament and of the
heading: 4. A natural gas undertaking which fails to provide the information required
text_raw:
4. A natural gas undertaking which fails to provide the information required 
under Article 14(6) or (7) of the EU Regulation shall be guilty of an offence and 
shall be liable - 

(a) on summary conviction, to a class A fine, or 

(b) on conviction on indictment, to a fine not exceeding €500,000. 

Offence by body corporate
text_norm: 4 natural gas undertaking fails provide information required article 14(6) (7) eu regulation shall guilty offence shall liable - (a) summary conviction class fine (b) conviction indictment fine exceeding eur500 000 offence body corporate

title: full effect to Regulation (EU) 2017/1938 of the European Parliament and of the
heading: 5. Where an offence under these Regulations is committed by a body
text_raw:
5. Where an offence under these Regulations is committed by a body 
corporate and is proved to have been so committed with the consent or 
connivance of, or to be attributable to any wilful neglect on the part of any 
person, being a director, manager, secretary or other officer of the body 
corporate, or a person who was purporting to act in any such capacity, that 
person, as well as the body corporate, shall be guilty of an offence and shall be 
liable to be proceeded against and punished as if he or she were guilty of the 
first-mentioned offence. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [745] 

Prosecution of offences

title: full effect to Regulation (EU) 2017/1938 of the European Parliament and of the
heading: 6. Summary proceedings for an offence under these Regulations may be
text_raw:
6. Summary proceedings for an offence under these Regulations may be 

brought and prosecuted by the Commission. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

30 December 2020. 

EAMON RYAN 

Minister for the Environment, Climate and 
Communications.
